title: Baker Hughes Misses 3Q Expectations
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Baker Hughes Co.'s (BKR) third-quarter results fell short of analysts' expectations, though profit and revenue rose.

The oil-field-product holding company posted a profit of $57 million, or 11 cents a share, compared with $13 million, or 3 cents a share, in the same quarter last year. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of 21 cents a share.

On an adjusted basis, earnings were 21 cents a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of 24 cents a share.

Revenue rose 4% to $5.88 billion, driven by gains in oil-field services and equipment that offset declines in turbomachinery and process solutions as well as digital solutions. Analysts were expecting $6.11 billion.

Orders rose 35% to $7.78 billion for the quarter, the company said.

Chief Executive Lorenzo Simonelli said 80 million tons per annum of new capacity have reached final investment decision since the fourth quarter of 2018, and that it is on track to reach its targeted 100 million tons per annum by the end of the year.

Write to Dave Sebastian at dave.sebastian@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 07:20 ET (11:20 GMT)
